meanings.definition: A small, narrow opening or crevice in a wall or rock.
meanings.sent1: The mouse squeezed through the crannies in the wall to find its way out.
meanings.sent2: She found a hidden note tucked away in one of the crannies of the old castle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten loved to hide her toys in the crannies and watch us search for them.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight peeked through the crannies of the dense forest, creating a magical pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The explorer carefully examined the crannies of the ancient ruins, hoping to discover hidden artifacts.

meanings.definition: A small, sheltered spot or hiding place.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel built its nest in the crannies of the tree, safe from predators.
meanings.sent2: Children love to play hide-and-seek in the crannies of the playground.
meanings.sent3: The old bookshop had cozy crannies where customers could get lost in their favorite novels.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the park offered peaceful crannies for people to relax and unwind.
meanings.sent5: The cat found a warm cranny under the blankets to take a nap in.
